markdownRemark.html:
One of my colleagues asked an interesting question this week. We were experiencing issues with react-helmet and someone proposed to just write our custom component to do the same.

The proposed implementation looked something like this:

function PageTitle(props) {
  useEffect(() => {
    document.title = `${props.title} — TravelPerk`
  }, [props.title])
  return null
}

To be used in this way:

<PageTitle title="My page" />

My proposal was to make a useTitle Hook instead. People didn't like it much but for what I thought was a peculiar reason:

I cannot see the benefit, not everything must be a hook now

Which is a fair concern. Just because Hooks are the new cool thing it doesn't mean everything should be a Hook.

But in this case I think a Hook is a better solution than a Component.

Firstly let's see how useTitle could be implemented:

function useTitle(title) {
  useEffect(() => {
    document.title = `${title} — TravelPerk`
  }, [title])
}

The implementation is almost identical as the one of PageTitle there are only two differences:

  • PagetTitle receives props, useTitle expects one string
  • PageTitle returns null, useTitle implicitly returns undefined

So, since the two functions are so similar why should you use a hook?
